title: 109_hr558
content: The Act titled "Guard and Reserve Readiness and Retention Act of 2005" allows for eligibility for retired pay for non-regular service. The Act "Guard and Reserve Readiness and Retention Act of 2005" amends the age and service requirements for retired pay eligibility for non-regular service members under title 10, United States Code. The Act "Guard and Reserve Readiness and Retention Act of 2005" amends the age and service requirements for retired pay eligibility for non-regular service members under title 10, United States Code. The number of years of qualifying service under this subparagraph shall be eight, and the combinations of minimum age and minimum years of service required for entitlement to retired pay are specified. The minimum years of service required for retired pay eligibility based on age are as follows: 53 years old - 34 years of service, 54 - 32, 55 - 30, 56 - 28, 57 - 26, 58 - 24, 59 - 22, 60 - 20. Amendment to subsection (d) of the Act adjusts the years of service required for retired pay eligibility. The amendment changes the years of service required for retired pay eligibility to 20 years of service computed under section 12732 of this title. The effective date for this amendment is the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. EXPANDED ELIGIBILITY OF SELECTED RESERVE MEMBERS UNDER TRICARE PROGRAM. The eligibility criteria for selected reserve members under the TRICARE program have been amended to exclude those enrolled in a health benefits plan under chapter 89 of title 5. Termination of eligibility is now tied to the termination of service. The TRICARE program eligibility for selected reserve members has been amended, including the repeal of an obsolete provision and clerical amendments to the table of sections. TRICARE Standard coverage for members of the Selected Reserve under section 1076d of title 10, United States Code, shall be continued until terminated after the enactment of this Act.
